children.subject: Compared to CS 162 or Info 159, is 161 harder or easier to self study?
We've tried to make all the resources for CS 161 public so you can self-study it. We have a textbook, recorded lectures, and publicly available projects.

history.content:
@Anonymous Beaker, I'm also in the predicament of trying to choose wisely courses that are not self-studyable vs courses that are better suited to self studying.

I'm thinking about this as I go, but right now I classify cs170 as self-studyable, mostly based on the fact that there is a MOOC on Coursera by Princeton on Algorithms. Note, there is a course by the same Professor, Robert Sedgewick, that is 61b. As for the probability courses, I know Data140 is supposed to be singular, but I might also consider this self-studyable since there are at least 2 highly developed MOOCS I am aware of, namely on EdX, one by Professor Joseph Blitzstein, and another by Professor John Tsitsiklis.

Now that I am writing, I believe cs189 is also more self-studyable than not. Most of the material is available, and I think there may be an old edX course that is acessible. Also for cs189, I believe Stanford has online material available that would cover the material in cs189 well.

children.subject:
Wow, those are all courses I would be very proud to take! The only course I've taken of all that you've listed is data100, which I'm currently in. The list I was formulating are courses that might be more self-studiable from my viewpoint,  which is very naive, as I'm not even prepared to take almost any of the courses we're talking about. Plus, I'm sure even if one could self study those courses, I'm sure it'd be far inferior to having taken the course.

Anywho, I'm glad you brought this thinking about the academic journey up in this post. Props to you for having knocked out some seriously challenging (and hopefully rewarding) coursework. If you have any advice for me, I'd appreciate it! I'm taking data100 right now, taking cs70 next semester, and hoping to take 61c next fall and hopefully some of these upper divs after that!
Thank you Vincent. But unfortunately the courses you labeled as self-studyable are the courses I have taken. Now I just feel worse...

history.content:
I'm interested in taking some enlightening/must-take SWE or DS courses

So far I have taken or will take: DS 100, Prob 140, Stat 153, DS 102, CS 162, CS 170, CS 189, CS 186.

I'll really appreciate it if you recommend any SWE or DS courses you think is great! It could be from any department!

I'm also thinking to take CS 161 just because it's a cool topic, but on the other hand, I wonder if it's feasible to self study it. For me self-studying CS 162, CS 170, CS 189 is kinda not feasible, but self study DS 100 is kinda feasible.

Again, thank you in advance!
history.subject: Self Study CS 161 or other courses
